source.raw_text:
The Farmer's Carry is a full-body functional movement that intensely works grip, traps, core (abs, obliques, spinal erectors), shoulders, and back (lats, rhomboids) isometrically, while also engaging legs (glutes, hamstrings, quads, calves) for stability and movement, all within a pattern of loaded locomotion that mimics real-life lifting and carrying for improved strength, posture, and endurance. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]  
Muscles Worked (Isometric & Dynamic) 

• Grip & Arms: Forearms, hands, biceps, triceps. 
• Upper Back & Shoulders: Trapezius (traps), Rhomboids, Lats, Rotator Cuff, Deltoids (front/side). 
• Core: Rectus Abdominis, Obliques (internal/external), Transverse Abdominis, Spinal Erectors. 
• Lower Body: Glutes, Hamstrings, Quadriceps, Calves (for stabilization and stepping). [1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10]  

Movement Pattern: Loaded Locomotion 

• Foundation: A compound, full-body pattern involving holding heavy implements (dumbbells, kettlebells, etc.) in each hand. 
• Action: Walking a set distance or time while maintaining a rigid, upright posture with shoulders back and chest up. 
• Key Function: To challenge your body's ability to stabilize the spine and maintain balance while moving a heavy load, promoting real-world strength and core endurance. [2, 3, 4, 6, 10, 11, 12]  

Benefits 

• Builds functional strength (carrying groceries, luggage). 
• Improves grip strength and endurance. 
• Enhances core stability and posture. 
• Boosts cardiovascular conditioning and work capacity. [1, 2, 4, 7, 10]
